content: over easy by melissa clulow over easy is a stylish and modern boxy sweater perfect for layering over t- shirts tunics and dresses the relaxed shape generous proportions and soft merino/mohair blend yarn make it an easy and comfortable garment for everyday wear the sweater is knit from the bottom up and is intended to be worn with significant ease through the body we found that the second size looks great on individuals ranging in bust size from 36 to 44 see photos page 3 however to help you decide on which size to knit we suggest selecting one which provides between 20 and 30 of positive ease you can also opt for a smaller circumference and use the body length indicated for a larger size technical skills finished measurements - film editing suites industry standard programs sizes 1 2 3 4 - camera operation body circumference 64 69 76 76 - cinematography sleeve length 8 5 8 5 7 5 7 5 - basic sound editing length from shoulder to bottom 18 18 21 23 - boom operation - screenwriting software use the following as a general guide for sizing based on bust measurement size 1 28 - 34 size 2 36 - 44 size 3 46 - 52 size 4 52 + yarn loopy mango mohair so soft 47% super kid mohair 53% extra fine merino wool 65 yds 60 m /50 g 5 6 8 9 balls shown in autumn leaves while the body and sleeves of this sweater are easily customized please note that adding length may affect yardage requirements tools 32 circular needle 15 mm us 19 or size needed to obtain gauge optional 15 mm double-pointed needles we knit our sleeves using the magic loop method with the 32 needles stitch marker to indicate beginning of round we used a loop created with waste yarn tapestry needle to weave in ends gauge 6 75 sts & 8 rnds = 10 cm / 4 after blocking espace tricot | www espacetricot com over easy pattern body cast on 108 116 128 128 sts join in the round being careful not to twist your sts place marker for bor knit in st st for 11 11 13 14 add length here if desired back from here you are working back and forth on the back only you can place front stitches on a stitch holder or waste yarn or simply let them hang on your cable as you work the back knit 54 58 64 64 sts work in st st until piece measures 7 7 8 9 from armhole ending with a ws row bobble all sts front work as for back sew shoulder seams 11 12 14 14 from each edge for larger sizes if you prefer a wider neckline only seam 13 per side neck as shown measures 10 wide sleeves with double pointed needles or circular needles if using magic loop method and beginning at underarm pick up and knit 26 26
